meanings.definition: A flat plate at the bottom of a piece of equipment or furniture to support or distribute weight.
meanings.sent1: The footplates of the chair kept it stable on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She placed the heavy box on the footplates of the trolley.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to balance on the footplates of the wobbly table.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the footplates that supported his weight during the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The footplates of the bridge were crucial for ensuring safety for all crossing.

meanings.definition: A metal plate on a bicycle pedal for the foot to rest on.
meanings.sent1: The shiny footplates on the pedals made cycling more comfortable.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the footplates on his bike to fit his shoes perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The footplates on the pedals gleamed in the sunlight as he rode down the street.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to finish the race was the footplates pushing her forward.
meanings.sent5: The footplates on the pedals provided a secure grip for his feet while cycling uphill.

meanings.definition: The part of a train carriage where passengers place their feet.
meanings.sent1: The crowded train had passengers standing on the footplates near the doors.
meanings.sent2: She rested her tired feet on the footplates of the train as it chugged along.
meanings.sent3: The footplates on the train were so small that only one foot could fit comfortably.
meanings.sent4: In her dream, the footplates of the train turned into magical flying carpets.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the train wheels was accompanied by the tapping of feet on the footplates.
